Pragmas to customize the database representation of the object model.

Templates

template pk() {...}{.pragma.}
Mark field as primary key. The special field id is mark with pk by default.   Source Edit 
template ro() {...}{.pragma.}

Mark field as read-only.

Read-only fields are ignored in insert and update unless force is passed.

Use for fields that are populated automatically by the DB: ids, timestamps, and so on. The special field id is mark with pk by default.

  Source Edit 
template fk(val: typed) {...}{.pragma.}
Mark field as foreign key another type. val is either a type or a "type.field" expression. If a type is provided, its id field is referenced.   Source Edit 
template dbCol(val: string) {...}{.pragma.}
DB native column name to use in table schema.   Source Edit 
template dbType(val: string) {...}{.pragma.}
DB native type to use in table schema.   Source Edit 
template default(val: string) {...}{.pragma, deprecated: "Default values are set automatically, this is ignored.".}
Deprecated: Default values are set automatically, this is ignored.
Default value for the DB column.   Source Edit 
template notNull() {...}{.pragma, deprecated: "NOT NULL is the default with all fields except `Options`, this is ignored.".}
Deprecated: NOT NULL is the default with all fields except `Options`, this is ignored.
Add NOT NULL constraint.   Source Edit 
template check(val: string) {...}{.pragma.}
Add a CHECK <CONDITION> constraint.   Source Edit 
template unique() {...}{.pragma.}
Add a UNIQUE constraint.   Source Edit 
template onDelete(val: string) {...}{.pragma.}
Add an ON DELETE <POLICY> constraint.   Source Edit 
template onUpdate(val: string) {...}{.pragma.}
Add an ON UPDATE <POLICY> constraint.   Source Edit 
template table(val: string) {...}{.pragma,
                           deprecated: "`table` has been renamed to `dbTable`".}
Deprecated: `table` has been renamed to `dbTable`
Set table name. Lowercased type name is used when unset.   Source Edit 
template dbTable(val: string) {...}{.pragma.}
Set table name. Lowercased type name is used when unset.   Source Edit
